lines.text: Well, I just figure any man who risks his neck to save a dog's life isn't going to kill someone for gold teeth.
[reporting for duty at his new post, Constable Adams is disappointed in his disheveled new commander]
What are you starin' at?
Are you Sergeant Edgar Millen?
Unfortunately. That look on your face would turn good whiskey into sour piss.
This Mountie here says that man should be brought in for trial. Now what are you going to do about it, Edgar?
I'm going to close my eyes and pray you disappear.
[shuts both eyes, pauses, than opens one eye]
Never had much luck prayin'.
If you're headin' up to old Curly's I can save you the journey. Skeeters got him last spring. Ate through his eyelids and pumped him full of poison. Curly finally got a gun and blew his brains out.
That's one way to stop the buzzin'.
Let me give you a little advice, kid. Just throw those law books away, huh? It's better to turn your eyes and let them fight their damn dogs. Damn sight better than them killin' each other.
But you can't let people get away with that - makin' up their own laws.

The only thing to remember is Millen's Law. You want to stay a Mountie, then all you have to do is keep headquarters happy, huh? 'Cause the only time they're unhappy is when there's an unaccounted for killing. So if you account for all the killings, you live to be a nice, ripe old Mountie just like me. You got that?
[Millen is unimpressed that Adams shot a deer]
Millen, don't you ever have anything good to say?
Whaddya want? A shout, a holler and a cigar for doing something right for a change?
No, I guess not. Your cigars taste like shit and you'd probably crack your face if you laughed out loud!
[Sundog explains the secret to winning drinking contests]
Take it easy, kid, take it easy. You have a lot of potential for a rookie, but damn you're ragged.
What do you mean - ragged?

Look, if you're in a do-or-die contest for big stakes, you let the other guy get a head start on you. Take small swigs and hold your breath, huh? Then it looks like you're getting ahead. When you see it's starting to circulate on him, then its time to bust it down. Then you're past him and then you pray to the good Lord that you get out of the place before you fall flat on your ass.
[Sundog explains why he's in the Mounties instead of baseball's Major Leagues]
Hell, they didn't want to let me in the Majors and you know why.
Damn right, I know why. I musta heard that story six hundred times...
Why?
I was too good, that's why. I'd a pitched that ball down Ty Cobb's throat and made George Sisler look like an electric fan.
I'm Captain Hank Tucker, RCAF. I've come to bring the fugitive to justice. Where's headquarters?
lines.character: The Pilot, Capt. Hank Tucker RCAF

lines.text: Wherever I'm standin'.
If anyone's going to bring in Albert Johnson, it's going to be me - not some bounty hunter or some flyboy buckin' for promotion.
Why you? Why are you so special?
He deserves me, not them.
You don't look like a mad killer.
You look like a mountie.
My old man told me never to trust you!

Johnson, we have a bad situation out here. We have a bunch of savages out here, just aching to splatter you all over the place. They don't want your side tall. Now if you don't come with me, that's all the excuse they'll need. They'll either kill you or get themselves killed trying.
You can't stop it.
[there is a gunshot]
Hold it!

[to Edgar]
Would it make any difference if I waited? If I left now I'd never know what it would have been like with you.

[about Albert Johnson]
We've been hunting a man who knows how to live off the land and use it to reign.

[about Albert Johnson]
As you can see he was one of the American's best trained men. Special Intelligence Squad and the law.
Purer fact is that he's running to save his hide, and every man he killed, he killed to protect himself.
What about Hawkins or Sundog or any of them? What did any of them die for, Millen?
Johnson didn't do anything I wouldn't do if I was in his boots. If I thought the killing would stop here, I'd let him go.
Your father said the best part of you ran down your mama's leg.
This is the dumbest thing I've ever done.
Oh yeah? What about Leon...
I thought I asked you not to bring that up again Deak.
Bring what up?
Uh... what's his name.
Leon?
Yeah.
That's dumb.
Yeah... shut up Deak. You're dumb.
Dumb. Leon. HAHAHahaha...
Yeah? You're dumb. Yeah, you're dumb. You're so dumb, you're so dumb I could sell you dirt.
[Deak steps forward menacingly, brandishing his rifle]
I'm sorry, I shouldn't have said that. I am, I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said that.
[Playing "My Darling Clementine" on an accordion]
Hope you can fuck better than you can play.
So go ahead, Sundog.Tell the kid what your real name is.

[reluctantly after a pause]
George Washington Lincoln Brown.
Eeee-yuk, yuk, yuk, yuk, whoooo!

[to Alvin]
I'm going in after him. Shoot anything that moves.
[pauses and looks at Alvin]
Except for me.
